'The Play' refers to a last-second kickoff return during a college football game
between the and the Stanford Cardinal on Saturday, November 20, 1982. Given the
circumstances and rivalry, the wild game that preceded it, the very unusual way
in which The Play unfolded, and its lingering aftermath on players and fans, it
is recognized as one of the most memorable plays in college football history and
among the most memorable in American sports.

After Stanford had taken a 20â19 lead on a field goal with four seconds left in
the game, the Golden Bears used five lateral passes on the ensuing kickoff
return to score the winning touchdown and earn a disputed 25â20 victory. Members
of the Stanford Band had come onto the field midway through the return,
believing that the game was over, which added to the ensuing confusion and
folklore. There remains disagreement over the legality of two of the
laterals, http://www.contracostatimes.com/ci_7588864 adding to
the passion surrounding the traditional rivalry of the annual "Big Game."
categories: History of the San Francisco Bay Area
headings: Joe Starkey's call of The Play
